online.game
Class square_geo_board<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>

java.lang.Object
  online.game.BaseBoard
      online.game.RBoard<CELLTYPE>
          online.game.gBoard<CELLTYPE>
              online.game.square_geo_board<CELLTYPE>
All Implemented Interfaces:
PlayConstants, Digestable
Direct Known Subclasses:
rectBoard, squareBoard, trackBoard
public abstract class square_geo_board<CELLTYPE extends cell<CELLTYPE>>
extends gBoard<CELLTYPE>

common support for square geometry boards with connections in 2 4 or 8 directions.

Author:
ddyer
See Also:
squareBoard, rectBoard, trackBoard

topRow

public int topRow()
return the row number that is being displayed visually at the top of the window considering the reverse_y switch. Normally, the top row represents the more distant board elements, and drawing should be from top to bottom.

Returns:
an integer

bottomRow

public int bottomRow()
return the row number that is being displayed visually at the bottom of the window considering the reverse_y switch. Normally, the top row represents the more distant board elements, and drawing should be from top to bottom.

Returns:
an integer

YindexToBC

public final int YindexToBC(int x,
                            int y)
Description copied from class: gBoard
inverse translate x,y indexes into the board array into col. This is used during board setup as part of the consistency checking on the the board/cell coordinate system. This has nothing to do with pixels on a screen.
